CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 °C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole afforded dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole , 14-17. NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 °C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1)
2. benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2)
3. benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3)
4. 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4)
5. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5)
6. 3-alkylthiophene (6-9)
7. tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13)
8. dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17)
9. acceptor units (18-21)
10. donor unit (5)
11. polymers (resulting from the Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21)

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph. Some of them are intermediates in a synthesis process, while others are the final products.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

8. dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 °C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole afforded dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole , 14-17. NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 °C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM - This refers to bulk heterojunction polymer solar cells (PSCs) that use a blend of PffBBn and PC71BM as the active layer.
2. PffBBn - This is a family of polymers with varying side chain lengths (n=10, 12, 14, or 16).
3. PC71BM - This is a fullerene derivative that is commonly used as an electron acceptor in organic solar cells.
4. 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione - This is an organic compound that is synthesized in the first step of making the PffBBn polymers.
5. benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone - This is an organic compound that is synthesized in the second step of making the PffBBn polymers.
6. benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate - This is an organic compound that is synthesized in the third step of making the PffBBn polymers.
7. 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene - This is an organic compound that is synthesized in the fourth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
8. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene - This is an organic compound that is synthesized in the fifth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
9. 3-alkylthiophene - This is a family of organic compounds with varying alkyl side chains that are synthesized in the sixth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
10. tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane - This is a family of organic compounds with varying alkyl side chains that are synthesized in the seventh step of making the PffBBn polymers.
11. dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole - This is a family of organic compounds with varying alkyl side chains that are synthesized in the eighth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
12. acceptor units - This refers to the organic compounds with varying alkyl side chains that are synthesized in the ninth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
13. donor unit - This refers to the organic compound 5, which is synthesized in the fifth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
14. polystyrene - This is a standard material used in gel permeation chromatography (GPC) to determine the molecular weight of the PffBBn polymers.
15. 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene - This is the eluent used in gel permeation chromatography (GPC) to determine the molecular weight of the PffBBn polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. BHJ PSCs - This refers to the type of solar cell that the materials are used in.
2. PffBBn - This is a family of polymers with varying side chain lengths.
3. PC71BM - This is a fullerene derivative that is commonly used as an electron acceptor in organic solar cells.
4. 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione - This is an organic compound that is synthesized in the first step of making the PffBBn polymers.

11. dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole - This is a family of organic compounds with varying alkyl side chains that are synthesized in the eighth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
12. acceptor units - This refers to the organic compounds with varying alkyl side chains that are synthesized in the ninth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
13. donor unit - This refers to the organic compound 5, which is synthesized in the fifth step of making the PffBBn polymers.
14. molecular weight - This is a property of the PffBBn polymers that is determined using gel permeation chromatography (GPC).

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 °C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 °C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

1. The maximum Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 9.93%.
2. The open-circuit voltage (Voc) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 0.92 V.
3. The short-circuit current density (Jsc) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 16.77 mA cm-2.
4. The fill factor (FF) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 64.36%.
5. The yield of 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1) is 70%.
6. The yield of benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3) is 85%.
7. The molecular weight of the polymers is determined using Gel Permeation Chromatography (GPC) with polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent. However, the specific values of the molecular weight are not provided in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. The maximum Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 9.93%.
2. The open-circuit voltage (Voc) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 0.92 V.
3. The short-circuit current density (Jsc) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 16.77 mA cm-2.
4. The fill factor (FF) of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells is 64.36%.
5. The yield of 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1) is 70%.
6. The yield of benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3) is 85%.
7. The molecular weight of the polymers is determined using Gel Permeation Chromatography (GPC) but the specific values are not provided.
